newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Kun Young Construction trading halted.
newsitem.headline: Kun Young Construction trading halted.

text.p: Trading in shares of Kun Young Construction Corp was halted on rumours that it had once again defaulted on its debt payments, the Korea Stock Exchange said on Friday.
"We're waiting to hear definitely from Kun Young's creditors," said an exchange spokesman.
Kun Young officials refused to comment on the talk, while those at SEOULBANK, Kun Young's primary creditor, were not immediately available.
On Tuesday, Kun Young defaulted on 1.26 billion won in promissory notes.

Later in the day it filed for court receivership after SEOULBANK rejected a takeover offer by a consortium led by Dongsung Construction Co. SEOULBANK said it would not offer rescue loans until the court recievership was approved.
